commits.subject: feat: add @coder and @data persona triggers
commits.body:
Two personas for focused interactions:
- @coder: development work (code, bugs, features, architecture)
- @data: extraction and processing (playbooks, reports, aggregation)

"feed the chicken" is now a command within @data persona.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #16 from devmade-ai/claude/mobile-fixes-timeline-8bNJi
commits.body: feat: add activity timeline chart and fix mobile layout

commits.subject: feat: add activity timeline chart and fix mobile layout
commits.body:
- Add bar chart to Timeline tab showing commits by date
- Multi-repo data shows stacked bars by repository
- Change period comparison from calendar to rolling (7/30 days)
- Fix mobile layout: stack headers on small screens
- Update documentation with new features

commits.subject: Merge pull request #15 from devmade-ai/claude/plan-next-priorities-8klm9
commits.body: feat: add heatmap, dark mode, and filter persistence

commits.subject: feat: add remaining polish and infrastructure features
commits.body:
- Developer Activity Patterns: per-author timing breakdown in Timing tab
- Configurable Work Hours: start/end selectors (default 8-17)
- Loading States: spinner during data auto-load
- Color Palette: removed duplicate CSS definitions
- Private Mode: sanitize names/messages for sensitive repos

Completes all lower priority items from TODO.md

commits.subject: feat: add heatmap, dark mode, and filter persistence
commits.body:
- Add activity heatmap to Timing tab (24×7 hour/day grid)
- Add dark mode toggle with system preference detection
- Add localStorage persistence for filters, tab, and settings
- Update documentation with new features

Implements stretch goal (heatmap) and infrastructure items
(dark mode, filter persistence) from TODO.md

commits.subject: Merge pull request #14 from devmade-ai/claude/review-todo-items-fZVwp
commits.body: feat: add PDF export and shareable links (Priority 4)

commits.subject: chore: update extracted data (570 commits across 4 repos)
refactor: remove all vanity metrics from dashboard
commits.body:
Audit and cleanup - removed every element that shows meaningless counts:

Progress Tab:
- Remove: Monthly Commit Volume, Cumulative Lines charts
- Add: Complexity Over Time chart

Contributors Tab (complete rework):
- Remove: Commits by Contributor, Lines by Contributor charts
- Remove: Contributor Details list
- Add: "Who Does What" - work type breakdown per person
- Add: Complexity by Contributor chart

Timeline Tab:
- Remove: Commit Timeline chart
- Remove: +/- lines from commit display
- Add: Complexity badge on each commit

Summary Tab:
- Remove: "Top Contributor", "Busiest Day" highlights
- Remove: "Avg commits/day" stat
- Add: "Complex Changes", "Quality Work" highlights

Dashboard now shows only meaningful work metrics:
what kind of work, who does what, and how complex it is.

commits.subject: refactor: replace vanity metrics with meaningful work metrics
commits.body:
Remove commits/lines focus, add metrics that actually matter:

Summary Cards:
- Lines Added → Files Changed (scope)
- Lines Removed → Avg Complexity (1-5)
- Commits → Top Work Type (focus)

Executive Summary:
- Commits → Features Built
- Contributors → Bugs Fixed
- Add Complexity + Files Touched with trends

The dashboard now shows what kind of work is being done,
how complex it is, and how much of the codebase is affected -
not vanity metrics like line counts.
